title: In mission mode for critical tech
description: India is building its own capacity in semiconductors, quantum computing, artificial intelligence, space technology, and biomanufacturing. All of it for missions
content: For decades, India’s brightest young minds often dreamed of working on technologies that seemed out of reach—chips, rockets, quantum computers. Those dreams are no longer distant. Under Prime Minister Narendra Modi, they are turning into reality, sti... [4947 chars]

title: Is XA76P the Next Big AI Token Revolutionizing Blockchain?
description: It has always been rich in innovation in what it is. From Bitcoin that bestowed digital money to contract smartly with Ethereum, every wave of innovation added another new dimension to the progress in the field of blockchain. Presently, the trend is strongly looking at a very deadly combination: Artificial Intelligence (AI) and blockchain technology. […]

title: Waldo: AI tool can scan social media for hidden health risks
description: A new artificial intelligence tool can scan social media data to discover adverse events associated with consumer health products, according to a study published in the open-access journal PLOS Digital Health by John Ayers of the University of California, San Diego, U.S., and colleagues.
content: A new artificial intelligence tool can scan social media data to discover adverse events associated with consumer health products, according to a study published in the open-access journal PLOS Digital Health by John Ayers of the University of Califo... [2473 chars]

title: For these law school application essays, AI is required
description: Using artificial intelligence for admissions essays is often discouraged or prohibited. For aspiring attorneys hoping to land a seat at two U.S. law schools next fall, it's an opportunity to stand out from the crowd.
content:
Sept 30 (Reuters) - Using artificial intelligence for admissions essays is often discouraged or prohibited. For aspiring attorneys hoping to land a seat at two U.S. law schools next fall, it's an opportunity to stand out from the crowd.

title: Trump executive order aims to use AI to boost childhood cancer research
description: CHICAGO — U.S. President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Tuesday to bolster the use of artificial intelligence and provide an additional $50 million in research grants aimed at finding cures for childhood cancers, according to a White House official. The order builds on the National Cancer Institute’s Childhood

title: Amazon reveals range of new Kindle, Ring and Echo devices powered by AI
description: Online juggernaut Amazon has unveiled its next generation of Kindle, Ring and Echo devices, among other gadgets, that are all powered by artificial intelligence and connected to Alexa+, its AI-infused personal assistant, which made its debut in February.
content: The line-up, announced at a presentation and showcase in New York on Tuesday, includes new cameras for its Ring video monitoring device with a new AI facial recognition feature that allows users to register friends and family and notify them who is a... [1116 chars]

title: Doctors and nurses found to be better at triaging patients in emergency departments than AI
description: Doctors and nurses are better at triaging patients in emergency departments than artificial intelligence (AI), according to research presented at the European Emergency Medicine Congress today (Tuesday).
content:
Doctors and nurses are better at triaging patients in emergency departments than artificial intelligence (AI), according to research presented at the European Emergency Medicine Congress today (Tuesday).

title: She thought she was talking to her favorite celebrity. It cost her everything
description: The rapidly advancing world of artificial intelligence and deepfakes has given scammers powerful new weapons.
content:
By Hannah Fry, Los Angeles Times
LOS ANGELES — Abigail Ruvalcaba was intrigued when a handsome daytime soap opera actor she’d been watching for years reached out to her in a Facebook message.
